results.title: The Divided man: commitment or compromise
results.creator_credit: Milosaw Kijawicz, Film Polski, Miniature Film Studio and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: An animated film which proves the maxim that one cannot travel two roads at the same time without being diminished. Vascillating from side to side, a man struggles to make a decision. In an effort to make the “perfect” choice he divides himself and travels two paths. However when his two halves attempt to reunite one half has shrunk.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milosaw Kijawicz, Film Polski, Miniature Film Studio and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: Divided Germany
results.creator_credit: Matthias Walden and Profil Filmproduktion Report
results.brief_description: The division of Germany and events leading up to it. Originally an administrative partition it became a physical division when a zone was cleared, a concrete wall and watch towers erected. The drain on man power caused by the flight of one in six East Germans resulted in almost total cessation of movement to the West. As long as the wall existed, political tensions could not be relieved.

results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and Verity Films

results.title: Dishwashing by hand
results.creator_credit: Dale W. Imus, Donald F. Grant and Los Angeles City Health Department
results.brief_description: A film which emphasises the importance of hygienic dish-washing, showing that for health and attractive presentation in either large or small cafeterias, dishes must be scraped, pre-rinsed, washed, rinsed and drained. Both mechanical and hand methods are illustrated.

results.title: Discovery: Puri Puri
results.brief_description: An examination of the physiological consequences of the impact of Western civilisation on the peoples of Papua New Guinea. The program reveals the subtle and insidious ways in which the Western way of life has irrevocably disturbed the human ecology of Papua New Guinea, and suggests that, in order to achieve social and economic viability as a competitive nation, Papua New Guinea must achieve a state of biological fitness. Narrated by Robert Bruning.

results.title: The Discovery of television
results.creator_credit: John Lloyd, Alasdair Milne, BBC-TV and JBM Productions
results.brief_description: The discovery and development of television is not the story of the efforts of a single person, but of many people. It is a search through a tangled web of scientific discoveries, inventions, and developments, of ideas tried and rejected and tried again, culminating with the efforts of an enthusiastic team of professionals led by Sir Isaac Shoenberg. Describes the early experiments in television leading to the first regular broadcasts from London beginning on 2nd November 1936. The work of the pioneers is reconstructed using contemporary records and interviews.
